intro: Pentacalia jahnii, commonly known as the Jahnii pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
